faqs.question: Can foreigners buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can freely purchase property in Spain as non-residents or residents. EU citizens face no restrictions. Non-EU citizens may require a Spanish tax identification number (NIE), but can own property without residency. BLUE MED INVEST and legal advisors can guide international buyers through the purchase process and any required documentation.

faqs.question: What are the costs of buying property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Additional purchase costs typically include: transfer tax (6-10% depending on region), notary fees (0.5-1%), registry fees (0.1-0.5%), and potential legal fees (1-2%). In Murcia, buyers should budget approximately 8-10% of purchase price for additional costs. First-time buyers may qualify for tax exemptions in some cases.

faqs.question: What are property taxes in Spain?
faqs.answer: Spain's annual property tax (IBI) averages 0.4-0.6% of property value but varies by municipality. Capital gains tax applies when selling, typically 19-21% for residents and 24% for non-residents on appreciated value. Non-residents also pay a 3% wealth tax on properties exceeding €600,000. Consult a Spanish tax advisor for your specific situation regarding SILVER VIEWS ownership.
